segments.text: Seeing the woman so fixed on her dish brings me a sense of comfort.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It reminds me of home, of routines and simple tasks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I glance down at the puddle forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a twinge of disgust at how oblivious she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems to be in her own world, while chaos reigns around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus on the plate makes me think of how easy it is to miss things.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are stealing cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Part of me admires their bravery; they seem so spirited.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Still, I wish they would understand the dangers lurking around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And in this moment, I can’t help but smile at the innocence of their mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR
